meanings.definition: Take (a position of power or importance) illegally or by force.
meanings.sent1: The villain usurped the throne from the rightful king.
meanings.sent2: The dictator usurped control of the country through violence.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky cat usurped the warm spot on the couch from the dog.
meanings.sent4: The new manager usurped all decision-making power from the team.
meanings.sent5: The invading army successfully usurped the enemy's stronghold.

meanings.definition: Seize (a right or position) without legal authority.
meanings.sent1: The bully usurped the swing from the little girl at the park.
meanings.sent2: The corrupt official usurped public funds for personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel usurped the bird's nest for its own use.
meanings.sent4: The ambitious student usurped the class president title with a clever campaign.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox usurped the rabbit's burrow for shelter.
